Śivadharmaśāstram

शिवधर्मशास्त्रम्

[ daśamo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ दशमो ऽध्यायः ] [ upavāsaḥ ] [ उपवासः ]
nandikeśvara uvāca | नन्दिकेश्वर उवाच ।
1 nandikeśvara uvāca NK82NKo77EN ; nandīkeśvara uvāca NC45, 1: नन्दिकेश्वर उवाच NK82NKo77EN ; नन्दीकेश्वर उवाच NC45 , nandi u NK12a, nandikeśvaraḥ ŚS67PT72, nandikeśvaraḥ GKi , नन्दि उ NK12a , नन्दिकेश्वरः ŚS67PT72 , नन्दिकेश्वरः GKi , śrīnandikeśvaraḥ GL40
 श्रीनन्दिकेश्वरः GL40
 ------------------ The beginning of this chapter is lost in manuscript NK28 and the text starts with 10.50d. Naraharinatha's edition begins with atha paśupatimate śivadharme mahāśāstre upavāsagopradānavidhir nnāma daśamo'dhyāyaḥ | oṁ namaḥ śivāya and PT72 starts with || atha daśamodhyāyaḥ||
caturdaśyām athāṣṭamyāṁ pakṣayor ubhayor api | चतुर्दश्यामथाष्टम्यां पक्षयोरुभयोरपि ।
1a °ṣṭamyāṁ NK82NK12aŚS67NC45GKi GL40PT72; °ṣṭamyā NKo77EN
१ a: °ष्टम्यां NK82NK12aŚS67NC45GKi GL40PT72; °ष्टम्या NKo77EN
1b pakṣayor ubhayor api° NK82EN ; १ b: पक्षयोरुभयोरपि° NK82EN ; pakṣayoḥ śuklakr̥ṣṇayoḥ NK12aGKi GL40PT72, पक्षयोः शुक्लकृष्णयोः NK12aGKi GL40PT72 , pakṣayo śuklakr̥ṣṇayo NC45, पक्षयो शुक्लकृष्णयो NC45 , pakṣayoḥ śuklayor dvayoḥ ŚS67, पक्षयोः शुक्लयोर्द्वयोः ŚS67 , pakṣayo ≀kr̥ṣṇa≀sukr̥ṣṇayoḥ° NKoac77, पक्षयो ≀कृष्ण≀सुकृष्णयोः° NKoac77 , pakṣayo ≀kr̥ṣṇa≀kr̥ṣṇayoḥ NKopc77
 पक्षयो ≀कृष्ण≀कृष्णयोः NKopc77
abdam ekaṁ na bhuñjīta śivārcanarataḥ śuciḥ ||10.1|| अब्दमेकं न भुञ्जीत शिवार्चनरतः शुचिः ॥१०:१
1c abdam ekaṁ na bhuñjīta NK82NK12aGL40PT72; yo 'bdam aikaṁ na bhuṁjīta NKo77, १ c: अब्दमेकं न भुञ्जीत NK82NK12aGL40PT72; यो ऽब्दमैकं न भुंजीत NKo77 , yo 'bdam ekaṁ na bhuṁjīta NC45GKi , yo 'bdam ekaṁ na cāśnīyāc ŚS67, यो ऽब्दमेकं न भुंजीत NC45GKi , यो ऽब्दमेकं न चाश्नीयाच् ŚS67 , abdam ekatra bhuñjīta EN
अब्दमेकत्र भुञ्जीत EN
1d śuciḥ NK82NK12aNKo77ŚS67GKi PT72EN ; śuci NC45
 १ d: शुचिः NK82NK12aNKo77ŚS67GKi PT72EN ; शुचि NC45
 ------------------ 1ab = SkP 28.60ab; cf. LP 83.3cd–4ab: aṣṭamyāṁ ca caturdaśyām pakṣayor ubhayor api|| varṣam ekaṁ tu bhuñjāno naktaṁ yaḥ pūjayet śivam| SkP 28.4: caturdaśyāṁ tathāṣṭamyām ubhayoḥ pakṣayoḥ śuciḥ| saṁvatsaram abhuñjānaḥ śānto dānto jitendriyaḥ| KKT vi., p. 385: caturdaśyāṁ tathāṣṭamyāṁ pakṣayoḥ śuklakr̥ṣṇayoḥ| yo 'bdamaikaṁ na bhuṁjīta śivārcanarataḥ śuciḥ|| KKT vi., p. 387: saptamyāṁ ca tathāṣṭamyāṁ pakṣayor ubhayor api| yo 'bdam ekaṁ naktabhojī niyatātmā jitendriyaḥ||
yat puṇyam akṣayaṁ proktaṁ satataṁ sattrayājinām | यत्पुण्यमक्षयं प्रोक्तं सततं सत्त्रयाजिनाम् ।
2a yat NK82NK12aNC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; yaḥ NKo77 •
 २ a: यत् NK82NK12aNC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; यः NKo77 •

 2b sattra° NK82NK12aNKo77NC45GKi GL40PT72EN ; tatra ŚS67
 २ b: सत्त्र° NK82NK12aNKo77NC45GKi GL40PT72EN ; तत्र ŚS67
satyavādiṣu yat puṇyaṁ yat puṇyam r̥tugāminām ||10.2|| सत्यवादिषु यत्पुण्यं यत्पुण्यमृतुगामिनाम् ॥१०:२
2d yat puṇyam r̥tugāminām NK12a; yat puṇyaṁ tīthagāminām NK82, २ d: यत्पुण्यमृतुगामिनाम् NK12a; यत्पुण्यं तीथगामिनाम् NK82 , r̥tukālābhigaminām NKo77, yat puṇya rindragāminām NC45, ऋतुकालाभिगमिनाम् NKo77 , यत्पुण्य रिन्द्रगामिनाम् NC45 , yat puṇyaṁ gānananartanaiḥ ŚS67, yat puṇyaṁ tīrthagāminām GKi GL40PT72EN

agnihotr̥ṣu yat puṇyaṁ yat puṇyaṁ yajñayājinām | अग्निहोतृषु यत्पुण्यं यत्पुण्यं यज्ञयाजिनाम् ।

tat puṇyaṁ sakalaṁ tasya śivalokaṁ sa gacchati ||10.3|| तत्पुण्यं सकलं तस्य शिवलोकं स गच्छति ॥१०:३
3c puṇyaṁ sakalaṁ tasya NK82NK12aGL40PT72EN ; puṇya sakalan tasya NKo77, ३ c: पुण्यं सकलं तस्य NK82NK12aGL40PT72EN ; पुण्य सकलन्तस्य NKo77 , puṇyaṁ sakalaṁ tasya NC45, puṇyaphalabhoktā sa ŚS67, puṇyaṁ sakalaṁ prāpya GKi

 ------------------ 3cd SkP 28.5cd: tac caiva phalam āpnoti yamaṁ caiva na paśyati|| KKT vi., p. 286: tat puṇyaṁ sakalaṁ tasya śivalokaṁ ca gacchati| KKT vi., p. 287: tat phalaṁ khalu prāpyāsau mama lokam upaiti saḥ|
[ parvabhūbhājanavratam ] [ पर्वभूभाजनव्रतम् ]
yaḥ pr̥thvīṁ bhājanaṁ kr̥tvā bhuṅkte parvasu yatnataḥ | यः पृथ्वीं भाजनं कृत्वा भुङ्क्ते पर्वसु यत्नतः ।
4a yaḥ pr̥thvīṁ NK82EN ; yaḥ pr̥thvī° NK12aNKo77NC45, pr̥thivī° ŚS67PT72, ४ a: यः पृथ्वीं NK82EN ; यः पृथ्वी° NK12aNKo77NC45 , पृथिवी° ŚS67PT72 , pr̥thivīṁ GKi GL40 •

dvayor māsasya pañcamyor dvayoḥ pratipador naraḥ | द्वयोर्मासस्य पञ्चम्योर्द्वयोः प्रतिपदोर्नरः ।
5ab dvayor māsasya pañcamyor dvayoḥ pratipadorNK82EN GKi GL40; ५ ab: द्वयोर्मासस्य पञ्चम्योर्द्वयोः प्रतिपदोर् NK82EN GKi GL40; dve pañcamyāṁ tu māsasya dve caparipade NK12a, द्वे पञ्चम्यां तु मासस्य द्वे चपरिपदे NK12a , dau pañcamyau tu māsasya dve ca patipade NKo77, दौ पञ्चम्यौ तु मासस्य द्वे च पतिपदे NKo77 , dau pañcamyau tu māsasya dve ca patipadau NC45, दौ पञ्चम्यौ तु मासस्य द्वे च पतिपदौ NC45 , pañcamī dvitaye yaś ca pratipaddvitaye ŚS67, पञ्चमी द्वितये यश्च प्रतिपद्द्वितये ŚS67 , dvayoḥ parvasya pañcamyor dvayoḥ pratipador PT72

[ kr̥ṣṇāṣṭamīnaktavratam ] [ कृष्णाष्टमीनक्तव्रतम् ]
kr̥ṣṇāṣṭamyāṁ tu naktena yāvat kr̥ṣṇacaturdaśī | कृष्णाष्टम्यां तु नक्तेन यावत्कृष्णचतुर्दशी ।

 ------------------ 16 = LP 1.83.12cd–13cd
[ kr̥ṣṇāṣṭamīvrataṁ māse māse ] [ कृष्णाष्टमीव्रतं मासे मासे ]
kr̥ṣṇāṣṭamyāṁ prayatnena kr̥tvā naktaṁ vidhānataḥ | कृष्णाष्टम्यां प्रयत्नेन कृत्वा नक्तं विधानतः ।
17a °tamyāṁ NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; °tamyā NK82
 १७ a: °तम्यां NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; °तम्या NK82

mārgaśīrṣe śubhe māse śaṅkaraṁ devam arcayet ||10.17|| मार्गशीर्षे शुभे मासे शङ्करं देवमर्चयेत् ॥१०:१७

------------------ 26 BhavP 4.57.15: śrāvaṇe śarvanāmānam iṣṭvārkaṁ niśi bhakṣayet| bahusvarṇasya yajñasya naraḥ phalam avāpnuyāt||
māse bhādrapade 'ṣṭamyāṁ tryambakaṁ nāma pūjayet | मासे भाद्रपदे ऽष्टम्यां त्र्यम्बकं नाम पूजयेत् ।

prāśanād bilvapatrāṇām anantaṁ phalam āpnuyāt ||10.27|| प्राशनाद्बिल्वपत्राणामनन्तं फलमाप्नुयात् ॥१०:२७

 अब्ददीक्षाफलं लभेत् NKo77 , महादानफलं लभेत् ŚS67
 ------------------ 27 BhavP 4.57.16: māsi bhādrapade'ṣṭamyāṁ tryaṁbakaṁ nāma pūjayet| bilvapatraṁ niśi prāśya annadīkṣāphalaṁ bhajet||
īśvaram āśvine pūjya pītvā vai taṇḍulodakam | ईश्वरमाश्विने पूज्य पीत्वा वै तण्डुलोदकम् ।
28ab īśvaram āśvine pūjya pītvā vai taṇḍulodakam NK82EN ; २८ ab: ईश्वरमाश्विने पूज्य पीत्वा वै तण्डुलोदकम् NK82EN ; māse cāśvayuje'ṣṭamyāṁ harākhya prati pūjayet NK12aNKo77, मासे चाश्वयुजेऽष्टम्यां हराख्य प्रति पूजयेत् NK12aNKo77 , mateśvaram āśvayuje iṣṭvā prāśet phalodakam ŚS67, मतेश्वरमाश्वयुजे इष्ट्वा प्राशेत्फलोदकम् ŚS67 , māse cāśvayuje'ṣṭamyāṁ īśvaraṁ nāma pūjayet GKi , मासे चाश्वयुजेऽष्टम्यां ईश्वरं नाम पूजयेत् GKi , aśvinīśvaranāmānaṁ pītvā vai taṇḍulodakam GL40
 अश्विनीश्वरनामानं पीत्वा वै तण्डुलोदकम् GL40
pauṇḍarīkasya yajñasya phalam aṣṭaguṇaṁ labhet ||10.28|| पौण्डरीकस्य यज्ञस्य फलमष्टगुणं लभेत् ॥१०:२८
28cd pauṇḍarīkasya yajñasya phalam aṣṭaguṇaṁ NK82ŚS67EN ; २८ cd: पौण्डरीकस्य यज्ञस्य फलमष्टगुणं NK82ŚS67EN ; pañcagavya sakr̥t pītvā pauṇḍarīkam avāp × yāt NK12a, पञ्चगव्य सकृत्पीत्वा पौण्डरीकमवाप् × यात् NK12a , pañcagavya sakr̥t pītvā pañcayajñaphalaṁ labhet NKo77, पञ्चगव्य सकृत्पीत्वा पञ्चयज्ञफलं लभेत् NKo77 , taṇḍulodakam ālihya pauṇḍarīkāṣṭakaṁ labhet GKi , तण्डुलोदकमालिह्य पौण्डरीकाष्टकं लभेत् GKi , pauṇḍarīkasya yajñasya phalam aṣṭaguṇaṁ bhavet GL40PT72
 पौण्डरीकस्य यज्ञस्य फलमष्टगुणं भवेत् GL40PT72
 ------------------ 28 BhavP 4.57.17: bhavanāmāśvine pūjyaḥ prāśayet taṁḍulodakam| pauṇḍarīkasya yajñasya phalaṁ śataguṇaṁ bhajet||
kārttike rudranāmānaṁ saṁpūjya prāśayed dadhi | कार्त्तिके रुद्रनामानं संपूज्य प्राशयेद्दधि ।
29ab kārttike rudranāmānaṁ saṁpūjya prāśayed dadhi NK82GKi GL40PT72EN ; २९ ab: कार्त्तिके रुद्रनामानं संपूज्य प्राशयेद्दधि NK82GKi GL40PT72EN ; māse tu kārttike'ṣṭamyām īśānākhyaṁ prapūjayet NK12a, मासे तु कार्त्तिकेऽष्टम्यामीशानाख्यं प्रपूजयेत् NK12a , māse tu kārttikāṣṭamyām īśānākhyaṁ prapūjayet ŚS67, मासे तु कार्त्तिकाष्टम्यामीशानाख्यं प्रपूजयेत् ŚS67 , kārttike rudranāmānaṁ sapūjya prāśayed dadhi NKo77

 ------------------ 35 LP 1.83.13c–14b: pratimāsaṁ pravakṣyāmi śivavratam anuttamam|| dharmakāmārthamokṣārthaṁ sarvapāpaviśuddhaye|

dadyād gomithunaṁ cātra pāṭalaṁ samalaṁkr̥tam | दद्याद्गोमिथुनं चात्र पाटलं समलंकृतम् ।

------------------ 64 LP 1.83.31a–32b: jyeṣṭhe māse ca deveśaṁ bhavaṁ śarvam umāpatim| sampūjya śraddhayā bhaktyā kr̥tvā vai naktabhojanam|| raktaśālyannam adhvā ca adbhiḥ pūtaṁ ghr̥tādibhiḥ|
vīrāsanī niśārddhaṁ syād divā gām anugacchati | वीरासनी निशार्द्धं स्याद्दिवा गामनुगच्छति ।

 ------------------ 82 LP 1.83.46: kārttike ca tathā māse kr̥tvā vai naktabhojanam | kṣīrodanena sājyena saṁpūjya ca bhavaṁ prabhum ||

------------------ 83ab LP 1.83.48ab: dattvā gomithunaṁ caiva kāpilaṁ pūrvavad dvijāḥ

bhogāṁs tatra ciraṁ bhuktvā somaloke vaset sukham | भोगांस्तत्र चिरं भुक्त्वा सोमलोके वसेत्सुखम् ।

aṣṭamyāṁ ca caturdaśyāṁ niyatā brahmacāriṇī | अष्टम्यां च चतुर्दश्यां नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी ।

kāruṇyāt sarvanārīṇāṁ narāṇāṁ ca viśeṣataḥ ||10.118|| कारुण्यात्सर्वनारीणां नराणां च विशेषतः ॥१०:११८
tasmāt sarvaprayatnena umāmaheśvaraṁ vratam | तस्मात्सर्वप्रयत्नेन उमामहेश्वरं व्रतम् ।

trisaptakulajaiḥ sārdhaṁ śivaloke mahīyate ||10.206|| त्रिसप्तकुलजैः सार्धं शिवलोके महीयते ॥१०:२०६

 २१७ b: °शोभनम् NK28NK82NK12aNKo77ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; °शोभनाः NC45

 २१७ c: सार्धं NK28NK12aNC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; सार्ध NK82NKo77

218c mahāyānai° NK28NKo77NC45ŚS67GKi ; anekākā° NK82EN , anena kāma° GL40PT72 •
 २१८ c: महायानै° NK28NKo77NC45ŚS67GKi ; अनेकाका° NK82EN , अनेन काम° GL40PT72 •

 २१८ d: °पूजितैः NK28NK82NKo77ŚS67GKi pcEN ; °पूजितः NC45GKi ac , °वन्दितैः GL40PT72

śatarudrabalopeto vīrabhadra ivāparaḥ | शतरुद्रबलोपेतो वीरभद्र इवापरः ।
219a śata° NK28NK82NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72; sa tu EN
२१९ a: शत° NK28NK82NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi GL40PT72; स तु EN
219b °bhadra ivā° NK82NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi pcPT72; °bhadro ivā° NK28, २१९ b: °भद्र इवा° NK82NK12aNKo77NC45ŚS67GKi pcPT72; °भद्रो इवा° NK28 , °rudra ivā° GKi ac, °bhadra yivā° GL40, °bhadraṁ ivā° EN
°रुद्र इवा° GKi ac , °भद्र यिवा° GL40 , °भद्रं इवा° EN
gatvā śivapuraṁ divyam aśeṣādhipatir bhavet ||10.219|| गत्वा शिवपुरं दिव्यमशेषाधिपतिर्भवेत् ॥१०:२१९

 २२० a: तु NK28NK82NK12aNKo77NC45GKi GL40PT72EN ; स ŚS67 •

 २२१ a: सर्वज्ञः NK28NK82NK12aNKo77ŚS67; सर्वज्ञाः NC45 , सर्वयज्ञ° PT72 •

saptadvīpāṁ kṣitiṁ dattvā yat phalaṁ tad avāpnuyāt ||10.222|| सप्तद्वीपां क्षितिं दत्त्वा यत्फलं तदवाप्नुयात् ॥१०:२२२
222c °dvīpāṁ NK28NK82NK12aŚS67GKi GL40PT72EN ; °dvīpā NKo77, °dīpāṁ NC45 •

 222d yat phalaṁ° NK28NK82NK12aNKo77GL40PT72EN ; yat phalaṁm NC45, २२२ d: यत्फलं° NK28NK82NK12aNKo77GL40PT72EN ; यत्फलंम् NC45 , tat phalaṁ ŚS67, yat puṇyaṁ GKi •

pādadvayaṁ śiro'rdhaṁ ca yadā vatsasya dr̥śyate | पादद्वयं शिरोऽर्धं च यदा वत्सस्य दृश्यते ।
223a °dvayaṁ NK28NK82NK12aNKo77GKi GL40; °dvayāṁ NC45, °dvandvaṁ PT72 •
 २२३ a: °द्वयं NK28NK82NK12aNKo77GKi GL40; °द्वयां NC45 , °द्वन्द्वं PT72 •

223b vatsasya dr̥śyate NK28NKo77NC45; vatsasya nirgatam NK82ŚS67GL40PT72EN , २२३ b: वत्सस्य दृश्यते NK28NKo77NC45; वत्सस्य निर्गतम् NK82ŚS67GL40PT72EN , vatsasya nirgatā NK12a, vatso vinirgataḥ GKi
वत्सस्य निर्गता NK12a , वत्सो विनिर्गतः GKi
tadā gauḥ pr̥thivī jñeyā dātā tu syād mahīpradaḥ ||10.223|| तदा गौः पृथिवी ज्ञेया दाता तु स्याद्महीप्रदः ॥१०:२२३
223c gauḥ NK28NK82NK12aGL40PT72EN ; gau NKo77NC45, sā ŚS67, dau GKi
२२३ c: गौः NK28NK82NK12aGL40PT72EN ; गौ NKo77NC45 , सा ŚS67 , दौ GKi
223d dātā tu syādmahīpradaḥ NK28; yāvadgarbhaṁ na muṁcati NK82PT72EN , २२३ d: दाता तु स्याद्महीप्रदः NK28; यावद्गर्भं न मुंचति NK82PT72EN , tadnānātsyānmahīpradaḥ NK12a, dātā cāsya mahīpati NKo77, तद्नानात्स्यान्महीप्रदः NK12a , दाता चास्य महीपति NKo77 , ttandānasyāt mahīpradaḥ NC45, tadnāne syādmahīpradaḥ ŚS67, त्तन्दानस्यात् महीप्रदः NC45 , तद्नाने स्याद्महीप्रदः ŚS67 , taddātā syānmahīpradaḥ GKi , dātāsyanmahīpatiḥ GL40hypometrical
 तद्दाता स्यान्महीप्रदः GKi , दातास्यन्महीपतिः GL40hypometrical
|| iti nandikeśvaraprokte śivadharme mahāśāstre upavāsagopradānavidhir nāma daśamo 'dhyāyaḥ || इति नन्दिकेश्वरप्रोक्ते शिवधर्मे महाशास्त्रे उपवासगोप्रदानविधिर्नाम दशमो ऽध्यायः ॥









Translation

Chapter Ten
Fasting –>

Nandikeśvara spoke:

|10.1| For a period of one year, on the fourteenth and eighth days of both halves of the lunar month one should refrain from eating, and [should] occupy himself with the worship of Śiva, in a [ritually] pure state.

|10.2| The undecaying merit that is taught to be gained by those who perform the great Soma sacrifice (sattra) continuously, the merit that is the share of those who speak the truth, the merit that is the share of those who approach [their wives] at the proper time,

|10.3| the merit of Agnihotr̥ priests, the merit of sacrificiers of sacrifices, all those merits will be his and he will go to Śivaloka.

Eating from the ground on parvan days

|10.4| He who eats using the ground zealously as a plate on parvan days will enjoy the fruits of [a sacrifice lasting for] three nights [or: atirātra?] in one day and night.

|10.5| On both fifth and on both first days [of the two lunar halves] of the month, a man should fast, perfume his body, and lie down with his beloved.

|10.6| He should rest with his mind motionless, avoiding the pleasure of sex. Listen to the meritorious rewards that he acquires while he practises meditation on Śiva.

|10.7| By this (tena), enormous penance will be performed, for a thousand and one hundred cosmic years, no doubt about it.

|10.8| Even if he has commited sins, his soul being completely purified by his devotion to Bhava [i.e. Śiva], he will eternally dwell in Śivaloka, surrounded by the Gaṇas, like Śiva.

The observance of eating only at night (8th–11th, dark half)

|10.9| By [eating only] at night from the eighth day of the dark lunar fortnight to the fourteenth, he will experience joy in this world, and the auspicious path [to Śiva] in the next.

|10.10| He who follows [the vow of eating only] at night on parvan days [so diff. vrata? Kafle 2018:343=yes] for one year, in chastity, his anger conquered, focusing on the praise of Śiva and on recitation,

|10.11| at the end of the year should feed the excellent Brahmins and Śiva’s devotees (śivabhakta) attentively (samādhi), and then he should say: ‘‘May Śiva be satisfied!’’

|10.12| If a person follows these practices, he will go to Śivaloka and will never return to the uncertain human world.

|10.13| Mandicancy is superior to fasting. [The vow to eat only] unsolicited [food] is superior to mendicancy. [Eating only] at night is superior to [the vow to eat only] unsolicited [food]. Therefore he should live following [the practice of eating only at] night.

|10.14| The gods eat in the morning, the R̥ṣis at noon, the ancestors in the afternoon, the Guhyakās and others in the evening.

|10.15| Surpassing all [prescribed] hours of the day, the supreme meal is at night. Mahādeva of left-handed practice rescues men at night.

|10.16| He who follows the practice of eating only at night should eat sacrificial food, should perform a [ritual] bath, [speak] the truth, eat light food, perform fire-sacrifices, and sleep on the ground.

The observance on the eight day of the dark half (month by month)

|10.17| On the eighth day of the dark half of the beautiful month of Mārgaśīrṣa one should definitely follow the practice of eating only at night, following the rules, and he should worship the god Śaṅkara.

|10.18| Drinking cow’s urine at all cost, one should sleep at night without having taken food. He will acquire eight times more rewards than that of an Atirātra sacrifice.

|10.19| Worshipping the Lord called Śambhu thus also on the eighth day of the dark half of the month of Pauṣa, he should eat ghee. He will acquire [the rewards of] eight Vājapeya Soma sacrifices.

|10.20| On the eighth day of the dark half of the month of Māgha, one should worship [the god] called Maheśvara. He should eat roasted barley and he will acquire the rewards of an Aśvamedha sacrifice.

|10.21| In the month of Phālguna, one should worship Mahādeva on the eighth day of the dark fortnight. Eating triśukla[?] he will receive eight times the reward of an Agniṣṭoma sacrifice.

|10.22| In the month of Caitra, one should worship [the form of Śiva] named Sthāṇu on the eighth day of the dark fortnight. When he drinks water in which flowers have been soaked[?], he will obtain the rewards of all sacrifices.

|10.23| In the month of Vaiśākha, [he should worship with] the name Śiva, and at night he should drink water in which Kuśa grass has been soaked (kuśodaka). He will obtain rewards eight times greater than those of a Puruṣamedha.

|10.24| In the month of Jyeṣṭha, he should worship Paśupati, and drink the śr̥ṅgodaka of cows. He will obtain the reward that one [normally] obtains by donating millions of cows.

|10.25| In the month of Āṣāḍha, he should sacrifice to the one called Ugra and eat cow-dung. He will receive a reward eight times greater than that of a Sautrāmaṇi sacrifice.

|10.26| In the month of Śrāvaṇa, he should sacrifice to the one called Śarva by[?] eating oil-cakes (piṇyāka). He will have fun in Rudraloka for an entire period of ten million years.

|10.27| On the eighth day of [the dark fortnight of] the month of Bhādrapada, he should worship the one called Tryambaka.

|10.28| In the month of Āśvina, he should worship Īśvara, and drink rice-water. He will obtain the rewards of eight Pauṇḍarīka Soma-sacrifices.

|10.29| In the month of Kārttika, he should worship the one called Rudra, and he should drink coagulated milk. He will obtain the rewards of eight Agniṣṭoma sacrifices.

|10.30| At the end of the year, he should feed those Brahmins who focus on devotion to Śiva. He should offer them rice boiled in milk (pāyasa) with honey with a generous amount of ghee,

|10.31| and at all cost gold and clothes, with devotion. He should offer a black cow that yields milk in abundance.

|10.32| If a man follows the ’observance of the eighth day of the dark half’ (kr̥ṣṇāṣṭamīvrata) thus for a year without interruption, the rewards will be the following.

|10.33| He will be freed of all his sins and will have all the powers (aiśvarya). He can live in Śivapura eternally and he will never return to this world.

|10.34| ... ...

The observance of Śiva

|10.35| I shall teach you the supreme observance of Śiva that aims at prividing men, women and other beings with Dharma, Love, Wealth and Liberation.

|10.36| When the month of Pauṣa has arrived he should follow the rules of eating only at night. He should speak the truth, his anger should be conquered, [living] on rice, wheat and milk.

|10.37| [On] the eighth day of both fortnights [of the month], he should definitely fast, he should worship Īśa and make an effort to perform a fire sacrifice at the three junctures of the day [dawn, noon, evening].

|10.38| At the end of the month, at full-moon,CHECK he should sleep on the ground, and consume ghee etc. Having bathed he should definitely perform a great worship (mahāpūjā) for Śiva.

|10.39| He should prepare an offering of one prastha of barley cooked in milk, and should feed eight Brahmins who are devotees of Śiva and give them gifts.

|10.40| He should offer Śiva a bull and a cow, and a brown cow, with ornaments and beautiful. Listen to the rewards of this.

|10.41| [He will be provided] with aerial chariots that shine like millions of suns, fulfilling all desires, full of Rudrakanyās, [drawn by] excellent bulls,

|10.42| adorned by groups of Apsarases singing, dancing, playing music etc., and he will be fanned with chowries and praised by gods and Asuras.

|10.43| Having three eyes and a trident in his hand, possessing all the powers of Śiva, he can depart to beautiful Śivapura, where Śaṅkara himself dwells.

|10.44| As many hairs he his offsprings and family members have CHECK that many thousand aeons can he dwell happily in Śivapura.

|10.45| Experiencing enjoyments as he pleases, together with his family members of three times seven generations, reaching knowledge and yoga, he will be liberated on the spot.

|10.46| From yoga, he will reach the end of sorrow (duḥkhānta). Yoga comes from knowledge. Knowledge comes from the Śivadharma. The Śivadharma comes from the worship of Śiva.

|10.47| Thus have been taught to you who live in the ocean of transmigration, who abide in the Śaiva āśramas, the gradual method of liberation by Śiva.

|10.48| When the month of Māgha arrives, he should follow the practice of eating only at night, eating kr̥sara dishes with ghee, with his senses subdued,

|10.49| fasting on the fourteenth day of both fortnights, or[?] on the day of the full moon, he should offer Śiva ghr̥takambala.

|10.50| He should also offer him a beautiful pair of a black bull and a cow. The rest should be done as taught and he will obtain the aforementioned rewards.

|10.51| With? aerial chariots that shine like sapphire and are drawn by peacocks, he departs to beautiful Śivapura and experiences enjoyments as he pleases.

|10.52| When the month of Phālguna arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, [living on] millet[?], milk and rice, his anger conquered, his senses subdued, and he should fast on the fourteenth and eighth days.

|10.53| At full moon he should perform a great bath. [He should live on] the five products of the cow, ghee etc., ... and with cow’s urine and dried cow-dung etc., the skin? of Kṣīravr̥kṣa trees, and earth-smell???.

|10.54| He should give Parameṣṭhin [i.e. Śiva] a pair of a red bull and a red cow with devotion If he proceeds with the rest as prescribed, he will obtain great rewards.

|10.55| Riding aerial chariots that shine like rubies and are drawn by elephants, he will depart to divine Śivapura and will obtain the aforementioned rewards.

|10.56| When the month of Caitra arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, He should live on pastry and milk, with his senses subdued.

|10.57| He should follow the practice of eating only at night wirshipping Rudra also in the month of Caitra. He should offer Śiva an ornamented and extremely beautiful pair of a bull and a cow of rose colour. He should proceed with the rest as before.

|10.58| Riding [aerial] vehicles that shine like topaz and are attached to chariots drawn by divine horses, he will depart to beautiful Śivapura that is difficult to attain by those whose self is not disciplined.

|10.59| When the month of Vaiśākha arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, He should live on boiled rice and milk, with his senses subdued.

|10.60| Resting in the cow-pen, meditating on Śiva at night, wearing only one piece of clothes, he should keep all the general rules as prescribed.

|10.61| At full moon in the month of Vaiśākha, he should bathe [and live on] ghee etc. He should offer Śiva a nice pair of a white bull and a white cow.

|10.62| Riding on great and ornmented vehicles that shine with the colour of swans, jasmines and the Moon, are drawn by bright white bulls, he will depart to the palace of Īśvara.

|10.63| He will be surrounded by women of all-surpassing beauty who smell like blue lotuses, and he will play with them for eternity.

|10.64| When the month of Jyeṣṭha arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, He should live on boiled rice purified? with milk, with clarified butter and milk added??.

|10.65| He should sleep out in the open air for half of the night and follow the cows in the daytime. He should always tend the cows selflessly.

|10.66| At full moon he should perform the aforementioned rituals including bathing. He should offer [Śiva] an ornamented and smokey pair of a bull and a cow.

|10.67| Riding on great, matchless vehicles that shine like the petals of blue lotuses, and that are drawn by noble lions, he will enjoy himself eternally.

|10.68| When the month of Āṣāḍha arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, He should eat [!adyāt] coarsely ground barley mixed with a lot of sugar and clarified butter and milk.

|10.69| He should offer Śiva a nice, ornamented and yellowish pair of a bull and a cow. He who keeps all the general rules as prescribed before,

|10.70| will live like Śiva himself, [riding] vehicles that are like clear crystal and are drawn by swans, possessing the powers minuteness etc.

|10.71| When the month of Śrāvaṇa arrives, he should follow the rules of eating only at night, living on food consising of milk and ..., focusing on the welfare of all living beings,

|10.72| He should offer Śiva a pair of a bull and a cow

a

a

a









Notes



|10.1| Are the days of the full moon and new moon also included implicitely?

|10.4| For this practice, see Kane’s History of Dharmaśāstra vol. 5 p. 339: ‘‘Parvabhūbhājana-vrata–-one should take his food served on bare earth on parva days; Śiva deity; reaps the fruit of Atirātra-sacrifice; HV II. 906 (one verse from Pad.).’’ Indeed, Hemādri in his Caturvargacintāmaṇi (vol. 2 part 2 p. 906) quotes a verse from the Padmapurāṇa:

pr̥thivībhājane bhuṅkte nityaṁ parvvasu yo naraḥ |
atirātraphalaṁ devi ahorātreṇa vindati ||
pr̥thivībhājane bhūmāv annaṁ nidhāyety arthaḥ śivo ’tra devatā |
iti padmapurāṇoktaṁ parvabhūbhājanavrataṁ |

|10.9| Here in the KKT (vi., p. 386) footnote 2 reads the following: ‘‘Hemadri adds: iti bhaviṣyatpurāṇoktaṁ śivanaktavratam’’|

For this practice taught in verse 10.9, see one of the entries at Kr̥snāstamīvrata [sic] in Kane’s History of Dharmaśāstra vol. 5 p. 289: ‘‘(7) begin on 8th of dark half of Āśv[ina] or M or Cai[tra] or Śr[āvaṇa].; deity is Maṅgalā Devī, ekabhakta, nakta, ayācita, and upavāsa from 8th to 11th and following days in the same rotation. KKV[?] 233–235, japa of 17 names of Devī to be performed’’

|10.17| Note that this sequence of months in verses 10.17–29 starts with Mārgaśīrṣa, similarly to Niśvāsamukha 3.92–105 (Kafle 2019:347). See also Kafle 2019:349: "The month of mārgaśīrṣa is linked to Viṣṇu’s awakening from slumber at the end of the rainy season–-according to lore, Viṣṇu sleeps during the four months of the rainy season (known as cāturmāsya) and wakes up on the eleventh day (ekādaśī) of mārgaśīrṣa. This is one of the months considered auspicious for commencing rites. In a broader, general sense, it is–-structurally speaking–-logical to begin a vrata in the month of mārgaśīrṣa, as it is the first month of the year in one of the more widespread Indic ritual calendars."

|10.118| See a very similar umāmaheśvaravratavrata described in Kane’s History of Dharmaśāstra vol. 5 p. 227.

|10.197| See a very similar vrata described in Kane’s History of Dharmaśāstra vol. 5 p. 426: ‘‘Śivarathavrata–-ekabhakta in Hemanta (Mārg. and P.) and M.; at end of M. make chariot decked with variegated cloth and haveing four white bulls yoked; place in chariot a liṅga made with the flour of an ādhaka of rice; drive chariot at night on the public road and bring to a Śiva temple, jāgara with illuminations and theatricals; next morning dinner to to Śiva devotees and to the blind, poor and distressed; this is ??vrata; present the chariot to Śiva; HV II. 859–60 (from Vi Dh.)’’
